SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.am11
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am11.view.client.GUI.utils

Class GuiResources

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am11.view.client.GUI.utils.GuiResources
public class GuiResources extends Object
The GuiResources class is a utility class that manages the graphical resources of the application. It contains methods to retrieve images and image views for various elements of the GUI. It also maintains a map that links resource URLs to an enum for easy retrieval.

  • Method Details

    • getTopDeck

      @Nullable public static @Nullable javafx.scene.image.Image getTopDeck (@NotNull @NotNull PlayableCardType type, @NotNull @NotNull GameColor color)
      This method is used to get the top card of the deck as an image. It formats the RETRO_CARD_PATH with the column name of the color and the card type to get the path of the image. Then, it retrieves the image from the path.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of the playable card.
      color - The color of the playable card.
      Returns:
      The image of the top card of the deck. If the image cannot be loaded, it returns null.

    • getTheImageView

      @NotNull public static @NotNull javafx.scene.image.ImageView getTheImageView (@NotNull @NotNull GuiResEnum res)
      This method is used to get an ImageView of the resource specified by the provided enum. It retrieves the URL of the resource from the enum, loads the image from the URL, and then creates an ImageView with the loaded image.
      Parameters:
      res - The enum value that specifies the resource.
      Returns:
      An ImageView of the resource specified by the provided enum.

    • getTheUrl

      public static URL getTheUrl (@NotNull @NotNull GuiResEnum name)
      This method is used to get the URL associated with the provided enum value. It checks if the URL is already present in the map. If not, it adds the URL to the map. The URL is retrieved from the resource file specified by the enum value.
      Parameters:
      name - The enum value that specifies the resource.
      Returns:
      The URL associated with the provided enum value.

    • getTheImage

      @Contract("_ -> new") @NotNull public static @NotNull javafx.scene.image.Image getTheImage (@NotNull @NotNull GuiResEnum res)
      This method is used to get the image associated with the provided enum value. It retrieves the URL associated with the enum value and loads the image from the URL.
      Parameters:
      res - The enum value that specifies the resource.
      Returns:
      The image associated with the provided enum value.

    • getUrlString

      public static String getUrlString (@NotNull @NotNull GuiResEnum name)
      This method is used to get the URL associated with the provided enum value as a String. It retrieves the URL associated with the enum value and converts it to a String.
      Parameters:
      name - The enum value that specifies the resource.
      Returns:
      The URL associated with the provided enum value as a String.

    • getCardImage

      @Nullable public static @Nullable javafx.scene.image.Image getCardImage (int cardId)
      This method is used to get the image associated with the provided card ID. It formats the FRONT_CARD_PATH with the card ID to get the path of the image. Then, it retrieves the image from the path.
      Parameters:
      cardId - The ID of the card.
      Returns:
      The image of the card. If the image cannot be loaded, it returns null.

    • getImageView

      @NotNull public static @NotNull javafx.scene.image.ImageView getImageView (int cardId)
      This method is used to get an ImageView of the card specified by the provided card ID. It formats the FRONT_CARD_PATH with the card ID to get the path of the image. Then, it retrieves the image from the path and creates an ImageView with the loaded image.
      Parameters:
      cardId - The ID of the card.
      Returns:
      An ImageView of the card. If the image cannot be loaded, it returns an ImageView with a null image.

    • getCardImageRetro

      @NotNull public static @NotNull javafx.scene.image.ImageView getCardImageRetro (int cardId)
      This method is used to get an ImageView of the card specified by the provided card ID. It checks if the card ID is in the list of invalid IDs. If it is, it retrieves the image from a specific path. If the card ID is not in the list of invalid IDs, it retrieves the card type and color associated with the card ID, and retrieves the image from the path formatted with the card type and color. Then, it creates an ImageView with the loaded image.
      Parameters:
      cardId - The ID of the card.
      Returns:
      An ImageView of the card. If the image cannot be loaded, it throws a RuntimeException.

    • getRetro

      @Nullable public static @Nullable javafx.scene.image.Image getRetro (@NotNull @NotNull PlayableCardType typeName, @NotNull @NotNull GameColor colorName)
      This method is used to get the retro image associated with the provided card type and color. It formats the RETRO_CARD_PATH with the column name of the color and the card type to get the path of the image. Then, it retrieves the image from the path.
      Parameters:
      typeName - The type of the playable card.
      colorName - The color of the playable card.
      Returns:
      The retro image of the card. If the image cannot be loaded, it returns null.
